page.title: 05MANOR HOUSE FARM
page.content: The farm is situated in High Shincliffe.Its land is within the A180,the A177 and a private housing estate. The land once belonged to the manor house of Shincliffe.The area of the farm is 250 acres.It is a mixed farm,with friesian dairy cows and a small herd of beef cattle.Grass is grown for silage and hay for winter feed,as well as barley,wheat and potatoes. Milk from the farm is transported by tanker to Sunderland. The farmer,Mr.Hopps,has a slurry spreader,three tractors,a combine,a plough,a trailer,a cutter and a bailer.The farm does a lot for the public.It provides facilities for school visits,preserves nature and provides food. Mark Short(10).
